text:
Server patching nights and weekends both praying for some servers to finally
break (hosting old apps users wouldn’t let go of on eol servers) but for most to
survive. 
Most of the time they busted up servers hosting apps that were needed by 8am. 
Even better when they would hose one of a pair of completely identical servers
but let the other one run fine. What the heck scenario’s not uncommon. 
Lots of praying and coaxing. Lol 
These days the sccm client on servers breaks much more than the servers do to
patching. 
Cynthia Erno
%40SA0PR09MB7116.namprd09.prod.outlook.com

metadata.email_text_original:
End of the week thoughts - what are your thoughts on 20 years of Patch Tuesday? 
Server patching nights and weekends both praying for some servers to finally
break (hosting old apps users wouldn’t let go of on eol servers) but for most to
survive. 
Most of the time they busted up servers hosting apps that were needed by 8am. 
Even better when they would hose one of a pair of completely identical servers
but let the other one run fine.  What the heck scenario’s not uncommon. 
Lots of praying and coaxing. Lol 
These days the sccm client on servers breaks much more than the servers do to
patching. 
Cynthia Erno
